etymology.description: 糸(糸) (mì, "silk") + 罔(罔) (wǎng, "net") = a net made of silk fiber -> net
etymology.interpretation: The character 網(wǎng, "net") represents a net made from silk, combining the silk radical 糸(糸) (mì, "silk") with the phonetic component 罔(罔) (wǎng, "net") to represent a net used for fishing or trapping, historically constructed from silk or similar materials.
etymology.simplification: 網(網) was simplified to 网(網) by removing the 糸(糸) (mì, "silk") radical, keeping the phonetic component 罔(罔) (wǎng) in a simplified form that suggests the same meaning.

examples.chinese: 船夫用𦉎(𦉎)，撒网捕鱼(撒網捕魚)。
examples.pinyin: Chuánfū yòng wǎng, sā wǎng bǔ yú.
examples.english: The boatman used a net to cast and catch fish.

examples.chinese: 他在池塘边搭了一个𦉎(𦉎)，来捉青蛙(來捉青蛙)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài chítáng biān dāle yīgè wǎng, lái zhuō qīngwā.
examples.english: He set up a net by the pond to catch frogs.
